div.p: FAFSA filing date is coming up October 1, 2018! Do not miss this opportunity for government funded education!

div.class: custom_150828 content-color well img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated 0

p.span: As everyone knows the State Board of EducationÂ has decided the safest way to finish out our school year is at home.Â Â
Parents are encouraged to contact your students teacher to receive their instructions for Distance Learning.Â Each Grade Level Distance Learning Plan will be different.

This instruction will be delivered to your home from a variety of tiered learning management systems. Ex.. TIER 1 students with internet and devices will do digital activities. TIER 2 students that have access to a cell phone will take pictures of their work and text or email it to teachers.Â TIER 3 students with no internet access will complete paper packets.

Google Classroom, Wonders ELA, Moby Max, Soft Seven Math Race, Renaissance Reading and Math, Class Dojo Zoom Conferences, Facebook Live, and traditional packets are some examples of Alternative Methods of Instruction our teachers will use to deliver Distance Learning.
Grade Level Teams have participated in a week of professional development to create Distance learning plans that will best serve our students and help them continue to grow academically.
Students personal items will be bagged up and a staff member will schedule a meeting for curb side pick up.

Beaver Elementary and Primary will do whatever it takes to communicate with you and keep your childâ€™s needs at the front of everyÂ decision.Â Â Your childâ€™s teacher will be available toÂ help you and work with you on any assignments or questions you may have.
We will continue serving your children breakfast and lunch each Beaver Duster Calendar School day from 11:30 until gone.Â This would also be a good time to pick up personal items.
Parents will be receiving a combination of personal phone calls, zoom conference calls, emails, class dojo messages etcâ€¦Â regarding instruction and future plans by our innovative teachers.
We appreciate you being understanding and working with us so well throughout this challenge we face.

The State Department of Education has sent us guidelines, frameworks, and assurances to help our district plan for you childâ€™s academic grow and success during Distance Learning.Â These resources are to guide and help our district plan for Distance Learning.Â Decisions will be made at the local level.Â Teachers have final say in their Distance Learning Plans.

div.class: custom_147917 content-color well img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated 0
div.p: We are not going add more stress to an already stressful situation.
Students will be able to access this information by looking at the school website and looking up their teacherâ€™s link on the web page.
If the student needs their school email and log in, any teacher can be contacted.
No classroom grades will be negatively impacted.
The grade may go down, from work that was turned in before the crisis hit. These grades may not have been included prior to leaving.
No INTERNET - No PROBLEM! Packet will have an equal resources.
Teacher support will be offered through email, phone calls, E-notes, Class Dojo, Google Classroom, etc., enrichment projects, research, journaling, websites, educational TV programs and more.

These suggested learning materials are to help your student maintain learning gains made this year. If you have interest in materials to help prevent the Summer Slide contact your childâ€™s teacher for more information.
Office Hours for phone calls will be 9 am to 10 am. Monday through Friday, unless the days were scheduled no schools days. School number is 580 625-3444.

div.class: custom_8911 content-color well img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated 0

b.font: Box 580Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â 807 Avenue G

span.font: Â Â Â Â On the wind-swept plains of the Oklahoma Panhandle lies the pioneer town of Beaver, Oklahoma, the first town built in the territory known as "No Man's Land." It grew from a small trading post on the Beaver River to a town of cattle trails, vigilante justice, and strong pioneer stock. The town has outlasted outlaws and gunfights, oil booms and oil busts, droughts and floods, dust storms and tornadoes. Each event made us stronger and more determined.

Â Â Â Â Almost as soon as the first cattle drive came through in 1886, the people started building schools and churches. Education has always been a priority to this community, and the school has always been a center of learning, activity, entertainment and community pride.

Â Â Â Â Beaver Schools is one of the premier learning institutions in the state. It has garnered numerous awards and is known for its innovative approach to education. It offers advanced technology combined with an emphasis on fundamentals ... small classes with expert teachersÂ guiding the way...first-class athleticÂ facilities that have produced a long list of champions...in academics, in athletics, in music, in providing tomorrow's leaders and citizens ... This is the Home of the Beaver Dusters.

div.class: custom_10215 content-color well img-responsive no-border col-md-12 wow animated 0
div.p: COMMON SENSE MEDIA FOR PARENTS - Digital citizenship needs to be taught to our students at school and home.Â These are a couple of good resources.

ThinkB4U.comÂ This is a great web site for students, parents and teachers to learn about many issues regarding social networking (Facebook, XBoxLive, Twitter, etc.)Â It is interactive and loaded with very good information.

p.a: 807 Ave. G } PO Box 790 } Beaver, Oklahoma 73932
807 Ave. G } PO Box 790 } Beaver, Oklahoma 73932
